responsibilities: Developed an application to make scanned Iranian historical archives searchable using Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG).
Converted scanned newspaper archives into machine-readable text, improving accessibility for researchers and historians.
Implemented full-text and semantic search to enable intuitive and efficient document retrieval.
Created a graph-based search tool for exploring document relationships via graph visualizations.
Built a chatbot interface for natural language queries to simplify archive exploration.
Developed a custom Agentic RAG solution offering vetted data, analytics, and visualizations through a chatbot interface.
Fine-tuned Large Language Models to improve semantic search, question answering, and function calling capabilities.
Built automated web scraping tools to collect large-scale data from over 50 sources.
Designed and built a data warehouse, reducing reporting time by 70% for business operations.
Created scalable ETL pipelines to integrate data from more than 11 sources efficiently.
Developed connected dashboards delivering actionable insights for marketing, finance, and operations teams.
Developed a semantic search system improving BC Data Catalogue's search precision by 25% and recall by 40%.
Created a topic modeling solution with interactive visualizations, enhancing the user experience for BC Data Catalogue.
Received two awards for project presentation and was featured on the UBC website for excellence.
Automated data scraping pipelines to extract structured and unstructured data from over 40 sources.
Developed and optimized ETL pipelines, improving data processing efficiency by 20% through streamlined workflows.
